1. Information

Japanese encephalitis is an acute viral infection that can damage the central nervous system, commonly seen in children under the age of 15. Diseases caused by Japanese encephalitis virus.
Disease spread by: mosquito-borne mosquito-borne gonadotropinous bites.
Disease symptoms: Fever and headache, mild fever, fatigue, there are also many cases do not have million, what if a typical case with up to 20 to 100 people carry the virus but no symptoms.
After 5 to 15 days of incubation, the disease will appear in 3 stages:
- Stage of onset: about 1 to 6 days. Patients with sudden fever, usually accompanied by chills, fatigue, headache, nausea and vomiting.
- Stage of disease: Continuous high fever 38 ° C - 40 ° C, prolonged; manifestations of meningitis (headache, stiff neck, vomiting and nausea, constipation); Disorder of consciousness (excitement or lightheadedness, overcast, can enter the coma); manifestations of localized CNS (convulsions, natural jerks in the fingers, tongue, eyelids or whole body, spasm); accompanied by neurological disorders. Mortality rates from 0.3% to 60%, depending on whether the disease is diagnosed early or late, the technical level of emergency resuscitation for cerebral edema, respiratory failure, cardiovascular disease and bacterial superinfection.
- Recovery phase: If passed, the patient can recover completely. Severe cases can cause paralysis in the upper or lower extremities, facial paralysis and / or sequelae of mental disorders, emotional instability, personality changes, mental retardation.

2. Preventive measures

In order to prevent encephalitis, Japan should actively vaccinate children under 15 years:
- Dose 1: at the child is 1 year old;
- Dose 2: after Dose 1 from 1 to 2 weeks;
- Dose 3: After the 2nd dose 1 year. Then repeat every 3-4 years until the child is 15 years old.
